verses.verse: A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> and Song <S%H7892><s%> at the dedication <S%H2598><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. I will extol <S%H7311><s%> thee, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>; for thou hast lifted me up <S%H1802><s%>, and hast not made my foes <S%H341><s%> to rejoice <S%H8055><s%> over me.
O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God <S%H430><s%>, I cried <S%H7768><s%> unto thee, and thou hast healed <S%H7495><s%> me.

O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, thou hast brought up <S%H5927><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from the grave <S%H7585><s%>: thou hast kept me alive <S%H2421><s%>, that I should not go down <S%H3381><s%> <S%H3381><s%> to the pit <S%H953><s%>.
Sing <S%H2167><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, O ye saints <S%H2623><s%> of his, and give thanks <S%H3034><s%> at the remembrance <S%H2143><s%> of his holiness <S%H6944><s%>. at: or, to the memorial

For his anger <S%H639><s%> endureth but a moment <S%H7281><s%>; in his favour <S%H7522><s%> is life <S%H2416><s%>: weeping <S%H1065><s%> may endure <S%H3885><s%> for a night <S%H6153><s%>, but joy <S%H7440><s%> cometh in the morning <S%H1242><s%>. his anger: Heb. there is but a moment in his anger for a night: Heb. in the evening joy: Heb. singing
And in my prosperity <S%H7959><s%> I said <S%H559><s%>, I shall never <S%H5769><s%> be moved <S%H4131><s%>.

LORD <S%H3068><s%>, by thy favour <S%H7522><s%> thou hast made my mountain <S%H2042><s%> to stand <S%H5975><s%> strong <S%H5797><s%>: thou didst hide <S%H5641><s%> thy face <S%H6440><s%>, and I was troubled <S%H926><s%>. made: Heb. settled strength for my mountain
I cried <S%H7121><s%> to thee, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>; and unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> I made supplication <S%H2603><s%>.

What profit <S%H1215><s%> is there in my blood <S%H1818><s%>, when I go down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit <S%H7845><s%>? Shall the dust <S%H6083><s%> praise <S%H3034><s%> thee? shall it declare <S%H5046><s%> thy truth <S%H571><s%>?
Hear <S%H8085><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and have mercy <S%H2603><s%> upon me: LORD <S%H3068><s%>, be thou my helper <S%H5826><s%>.

Thou hast turned <S%H2015><s%> for me my mourning <S%H4553><s%> into dancing <S%H4234><s%>: thou hast put off <S%H6605><s%> my sackcloth <S%H8242><s%>, and girded <S%H247><s%> me with gladness <S%H8057><s%>;

To the end that my glory <S%H3519><s%> may sing <S%H2167><s%> praise to thee, and not be silent <S%H1826><s%>. O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God <S%H430><s%>, I will give thanks <S%H3034><s%> unto thee for ever <S%H5769><s%>. my glory: that is, my tongue, or, my soul
